content:
It would be cool to have some attention on the (seemingly increasing) filter module bugs.

Is anyone here willing to join a bug hunting sprint?
Or is anyone willing to advocate for filter module fixes in the weekly dev meeting?

At least it would be nice if the problems with the filter module could get some attention in the next dev weekly.

The most recent bugs:
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4419
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4407

Regression in text filter format overview submit when disabled formats exist · Issue #4419 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug When at least one format is disabled and the filter format overview form gets submitted (changing the weight of a format), an additional empty format gets created, causing se...
Ordering text formats no longer works · Issue #4407 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
When trying to re-order the text formats on /admin/config/content/formats, they revert back to their old order on Save: This is on Backdrop v1.16.0. The row weights show the correct values, but in ...

@indigoxela I've added the bug milestone label to both issues. Once there are PRs for them that are in a "near-ready state", we'll be able to add them to the 1.16.2 milestone (see https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/adding-milestones-issues for details on how setting a milestone works)
Although at some point I'd like us to discuss being able to add issues like that straight to the next bug milestone, so to have more visibility.

...I think that the "It must have a recent pull-request in a near-ready state." condition should apply to tasks - not to bugs ...at least not serious ones, as these feel that they should go straight to the next bug milestone.
@klonos Good point. Want to make an issue for that? :wink:

Would that need to be a PMC decision you think @BWPanda (Peter) ? ...or file it against https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org ?

backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Issue tracker for the BackdropCMS.org website. Contribute to backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.

I don't think so. It says: "In order for an issue to remain tagged for the next bug fix release, it must meet all of the criteria below:" I.e. Issues still need two seperate people to mark it as a bug, and also a PR in 'near-ready' state (in addition to the core committer).
Yeah ...see how I removed my last comments :sweat_smile:
I think opening an issue adding such an exception would be a good idea though.

...done: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/688

Policy: Only require PRs for tasks for setting the bug milestone - not for bugs · Issue #688 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
